briefTitle: TAP vs Surgical Infiltration of Local Anesthetic in Laparoscopic and Robotic Hysterectomy
officialTitle: Transversus Abdominis Plane (TAP) Infiltration vs. Surgical Infiltration of Local Anesthetic in Laparoscopic and Robotic Assisted Hysterectomy

eligibilityCriteria.criteria:
Inclusion Criteria:

* ASA physical status I-III
* Females \>/=18-years of age
* Scheduled for laparoscopic/robot-assisted hysterectomy.

Exclusion Criteria

* Contraindication to surgical infiltration or regional blockade
* History of long term opioid intake (greater than 3 weeks prior to surgery) or chronic pain disorder
* Inability to understand the informed consent and demands of the study
* Surgery scheduled to start after 1700

primary.measure: Total Opioid Use for Pain Control
primary.description: total opioid used from time 0 after surgery through 72 hours after surgery was complete.

secondary.measure: Maximum Pain Scores as Measured by Numerical Pain Rating Scale (0-10)
secondary.description: the Numerical rating scale goes from 0 (lowest) to 10 (highest). Higher values are a worse outcome. The maximal number for maximal pain scores from 0-72 hours is 30. Thus the range for this outcome is 0 to 30 with 30 being a worse outcome. This is because the 0-72 hour maximal pain scores are additive from the 0-24, 24-48, and 48-72 hours. Each 24 hour subset has a maximal score of 10 and adding all three results in maximal score of 30.

secondary.measure: Total Opioid Taken by Patient as Tabulated and Converted to Morphine Equivalents

secondary.description: The quality of recovery is a survey given to patients. It is 15 questions. The scale of the QOR 15 Score is 0 to 150. 150 is a better outcome.
The overall benefit of analgesia score is based off 7 questions given to patients it is scored 0-28. 28 is considered a worse outcome.

secondary.measure: Number of Participants With Nausea and Vomiting
Length of Time in Phase 1 and Phase 2 of Recovery
secondary.description: time from start of recovery until patient was deemed ready to discharge from phase 2 recovery. Phase 2 recovery is the phase of the post anesthesia care where patients are readied to be discharge form the post anesthesia care unit. There are guidelines with regards to when patients are able to be discharged and when those points are met by the patient they are deemed ready to discharge.

secondary.measure: Number of Patients Admitted Post Operatively
Opioid Used From 24-48 Hours Post Surgery
secondary.description: opioids in mg of morphine equivalents used from 24-48 hours after surgery
secondary.timeFrame: 24-48 hours after the end of surgery

secondary.measure: Total Opioid Taken by Patient as Tabulated and Converted to Morphine Equivalents
secondary.description: opioid use from time 48-72 hours in mg morphine equivalents
number of patients who answered yes to if they were satisfied with their pain management

secondary.measure: Maximal Pain Score of Patient From Time 0-24 Hours After Surgery
secondary.description: the maximal pain score felt by patient during this time period. This is based on a numerical rating scale of 0-10. 0 is best outcome and 10 is worst outcome.

secondary.measure: Maximal Pain Score for Patient From Time 24-48 Hours After Surgery
secondary.description: the maximal pain score felt by patient during this time period. This is based on a numerical rating scale of 0-10. 0 is best outcome and 10 is worst outcome.

secondary.measure: Maximal Pain Score Patient Felt From 48-72 Hours After Surgery
secondary.description: the maximal pain score felt by patient during this time period. This is based on a numerical rating scale of 0-10. 0 is best outcome and 10 is worst outcome.
